edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.util
Class RunXilinxTools

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.util.RunXilinxTools

public class RunXilinxTools
extends java.lang.Object

This is a generic class which has several static methods to call Xilinx tools from within the RapidSmith framework.

Author:
Chris Lavin

getBinPathToLegacyXilinxTools

public static java.lang.String getBinPathToLegacyXilinxTools()

generateBriefXDLRCFile

public static boolean generateBriefXDLRCFile(java.lang.String partName,
                                             java.lang.String optionalOutputFileName)
Generates the brief version of the XDLRC file specified by partName.

Parameters:
partName - The part name of the Xilinx device for which to generate the XDLRC file.
optionalOutputFileName - Provides a way to generated a custom output file name. If parameter is null, the output file name is [part name + _brief.xdlrc]
Returns:
True if completed successfully, false otherwise.

generateFullXDLRCFile

public static boolean generateFullXDLRCFile(java.lang.String partName,
                                            java.lang.String optionalOutputFileName)
Generates the full version of the XDLRC file specified by partName.

Parameters:
partName - The part name of the Xilinx device for which to generate the XDLRC file.
optionalOutputFileName - Provides a way to generated a custom output file name. If parameter is null, the output file name is [part name + _full.xdlrc]
Returns:
True if completed successfully, false otherwise.

generateXDLRCFile

public static boolean generateXDLRCFile(java.lang.String partName,
                                        java.lang.String optionalOutputFileName,
                                        boolean briefFile)
Generates the XDLRC file specified by partName.

Parameters:
partName - The part name of the Xilinx device for which to generate the XDLRC file.
optionalOutputFileName - Provides a way to generated a custom output file name. If parameter is null, the output file name is [part name + _brief/_full.xdlrc]
briefFile - Determines if it should generate a brief or full XDLRC file.
Returns:
True if completed successfully, false otherwise.

getMinClkPeriodFromTRCE

public static float getMinClkPeriodFromTRCE(java.lang.String ncdFileName)
Convenient method to get the minimum clock period for a given NCD file. This method assumes single clock domain.

Parameters:
ncdFileName - Name of the existing NCD file to get the clock period from.
Returns:
The minimum clock period in nanoseconds, or Float.MAX_VALUE if none is found.

getMinClkPeriodFromTWRFile

public static float getMinClkPeriodFromTWRFile(java.lang.String twrFileName)
Parses a TWR file to get the minimum clock period. Assumes a single clock domain.

Parameters:
twrFileName - Name of the TWR file to parse.
Returns:
The number of nanoseconds of the minimum clock period or Float.MAX_VALUE if none found.

runCommand

public static java.lang.Integer runCommand(java.lang.String command,
                                           boolean verbose)
A generic method to run a command from the system command line.

Parameters:
command - The command to execute. This method blocks until the command finishes.
verbose - When true, it will first print to std.out the command and also all of the command's output (both std.out and std.err) to std.out.
Returns:
The return value of the process if it terminated, if there was a problem it returns null.

getPartNames

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPartNames(java.lang.String familyName,
                                                                 boolean includeSpeedGrades)
An easy way to just get one family of part names at a time. See getPartNames(String[] familyNames, boolean includeSpeedGrades)

Parameters:
familyName - The single family name to get part names for.
includeSpeedGrades - A flag indicating to include all parts by various speed grades.
Returns:
All installed part names for the specified family, or null if none were specified.

getPartNames

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPartNames(java.lang.String[] familyNames,
                                                                 boolean includeSpeedGrades)
Runs Xilinx PartGen to obtain all installed Xilinx FPGA part names for a given set of families.

Parameters:
familyNames - Names of the Xilinx FPGA families (virtex4, virtex5, ...) to generate names for.
includeSpeedGrades - A flag indicating to include all parts by various speed grades.
Returns:
All installed part names for the specified families, or null if none were specified.
